Key Metrics Of An E-commerce Site

Like your campaign and product performance — your online store must be measurable too.

The site makes the sales — you must fine tune every aspect to keep it perform better.

Single Point Of Success, Single Point Of Failure

Your website is your front-end and has the largest impact on your entire business.

Usually 1-2% of your visitors reaching your site are converted into customers. Now imagine a 5-6% conversion rate. That would immediately triple your sales.

The Conversion Rate is that single point where all your efforts can be turned either into success or into failure.

With:

  • A high conversion rate your energies spent on marketing and product creation are multiplied.

  • A low conversion rate no matter how good your products are and how much traffic you drive to your site — your sales will be modest.

Visitors Conversion Rate Customers Average Sales Value Revenue
5,000 1% 50 $30 $1,500
2,000 5% 100 $30 $3,000

Put simply, Conversion Rate is the

willingness

of your visitors to become customers, to buy your products.

Understanding Willingness

  1. Smooth Shopping Experience +

    • Page Speed +

      If your site is slow your visitors will go away.

    • Usability +

      If you don't stay away from your visitors way they won't convert into customers.

  2. Desire +

    • Design +

      If your presentation is broken they might like the products but they won't choose your site to shop them.

    • Content +

      Add a personal touch to whatever you sell. Assure visitors you are a pro in this niche.

  3. Safety and Affordability +

    • Price +

      Make them understand you strategy. Make them understand you play fair.

    • Shopping Services +

      Payment, delivery, return. These must rock too!

 

All of them are to increase the Conversion Rate
